page.title: 13HIGH ERCALL HALL HIGH ERCALL
page.content: Hamo Peveril bought High Ercall in 1098 and it remained in his family until 1271. It was then given to the De Ercalls. It then stayed with the De Ercalls until 1391. Then a cousin of William De Ercall gave High Ercall to Thomas Newport-a parson. Thomas Newport became Lord of the Manor and in 1608 Francis Newport started to build High Ercall Hall. Francis Newport built a strong wall round the Hall and a moat, then later on he built a draw bridge over the moat. The Hall is three storeys high, the lower part is built up of sand stone blocks with the upper part built of brick. The sand stone blocks have come from Viriconium the Roman village on horse and cart. Some of them also could have come from Haughmond Abbey. By Tim Shrosbree.
